Author: josephnicholas GMT+8#5904
Content: @TonyL I need to do an asset chain first? I was thinking of directly using it... So are there any steps to do it?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
Cryptoconditions not activated on main KMD chain, so you need to start your own assetchain with activated cryptoconditons or use some existing one  (https://docs.komodoplatform.com/komodo/assetchain-params.html?params#ac-cc ac_cc param determines if cryptoconditons are activated)
You can follow this guide (just add -ac_cc param):
https://developers.komodoplatform.com/basic-docs/installations/creating-asset-chains.html#creating-a-new-asset-chain

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: https://docs.komodoplatform.com/komodo/assetchain-params.html here you can find the detailed description of assetchain customisation params

Author: josephnicholas GMT+8#5904
Content: @TonyL awesome! Thank you very much.

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: You're most welcome! Feel free to drop your questions if you'll have any

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
Actually start new blockchain is super simple.
On the first node start daemon like a:
```./komodod -ac_name=GWTEST2 -ac_supply=5555555 -ac_reward=10000000000000 -ac_cc=2 --daemon```
And on the second node:
```./komodod -ac_name=GWTEST2 -ac_supply=5555555 -ac_reward=10000000000000 -ac_cc=2 -addnode=firstnodeip -gen --daemon```

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Then just get `pubkey` from validateaddress, restart daemons with valid `-pubkey=` param and you good to go with CC RPC interaction

Author: josephnicholas GMT+8#5904
Content: Wow, this really neat!!! But will this  be resource intensive (CPU and network) since I am just on an old mac?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: If one of your nodes is old Mac it's better to start daemon with `-gen` param on more powerful machine. But it's not resource hungry actually. I'm using old Macbook Air for everyday work and can spin blockchains on it without problems

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: It only may be a little bit tricky if you want to start multiply nodes blockchain using single PC - there is workaround with separate configs which maybe quite confusing for a fresh mind start. Easiest way is to spin virtual machine for second daemon - but it can slow down your old Mac I wonder

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: So it might be a good idea to rent VPS or spin cloud instance (for example Google Cloud and AWS offers free trial periods for plays) for usage as a second mining node

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: I'm not a huge dPoW expert. In my understanding notarisation happened when state transaction is on Bitcoin blockchain (other words mined and included to block yes). Somebody will correct me if I'm wrong.

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: You need two separate nodes to issue commands above (blockchain with one node will not work). There is no easy way to make two separate nodes on single machine

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: https://blog.komodoplatform.com/delayed-proof-of-work-explained-9a74250dbb86 great article explaining dPoW

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
Use -ac_name= in every call for assetchain
./komodo-cli calls without -ac_name param issuing calls to KMD chain daemon - and KMD chain daemon isn't up on your node

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
`"connections": 0,` - means that nodes aren't connected
I think it's better to do vice versa.
1) Stop daemons now
2) Start daemon on VPS without addnode param
3) Start daemon  on laptop with `-addnode=<ip_of_VPS>` param

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: If your nodes connect each other you'll see ```"connections": 1,``` in getinfo
